DataElement.preferredName: Index and Measurable New Lesion Sum Product Diameter Result
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The sum of the products of the two largest perpendicular diameters of all index lesions.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Response Domain Index Lesion Measurable New Lesion Identification Sum Multiplicative Product
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to tumor response._The largest tumor lesion targeted by therapy._Capable of being measured._The identification of a lesion which has not been previously seen or characterized._The final aggregate amount._A quantity obtained by multiplication.

Property.preferredName: Index Lesion Measurable New Lesion Identification Sum Multiplicative Product
Property.preferredDefinition: The largest tumor lesion targeted by therapy.:Capable of being measured.:The identification of a lesion which has not been previously seen or characterized.:The final aggregate amount.:A quantity obtained by multiplication.

Concepts.definition: The most clinically significant tumor lesion targeted by therapy. The lesion is typically the largest or highest graded of the tumor foci detected.
The identification of a lesion which has not been previously seen or characterized.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Measurement Criteria
ReferenceDocuments.description: All index lesions refers to five lesions per organ, up to 10 visceral lesions and five cutaneous index lesions.
